docs.snippet: Dempster McIntosh, United States Ambassador to Uruguay, predicted yesterday that Latin America was on the threshold of a significant expansion of trade within its own area.

docs.abstract: Amb McIntosh sees intra-Latin-Amer trade up

headline.main: NEW GAINS SEEN IN LATIN AMERICA; U.S. Ambassador to Uruguay Says Nations Will Increase Trade With One Another

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, June 21 -- The Uruguayants are following Argentine developments anxiously. These happenings have a direct bearing on Uruguay's welfare.

headline.main: URUGUAYANS EYE ARGENTINE TREND; Their Land, an Anti-Peronist Haven, Hopes Relations of Countries Will Improve

docs.snippet: PARIS, June 22 -- Three American employes of the United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization, who failed to appear before a United States loyalty board, have been dismissed.

docs.abstract: 3 US employes of UNESCO ousted for failure to appear before loyalty bd

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay. June 22 -- An informant who knows General Lucero, said today the general might be keeping President Peron in power and not trying to supplant him.

headline.main: WOMEN'S U.S. OPEN STARTS THURSDAY; Louise Suggs, Patty Berg Are Among 49 Entered in 72-Hole Wichita Event

docs.snippet: MADISON, Wis., June 25 (AP) -- Patty Berg, St. Andrews, Ill., pro, cracked par by two strokes today to take a stroke lead at the 54-hole mark in the women's Western open golf tournament.
docs.lead_paragraph: MADISON, Wis., June 25 (AP) -- Patty Berg, St. Andrews, Ill., pro, cracked par by two strokes today to take a stroke lead at the 54-hole mark in the women's Western open golf tournament.

headline.main: Patty Berg Leads by Shot in Western Open Golf; ILLINOIS PRO GETS 2-UNDER 71 FOR 219 Misses Suggs and Crocker Second at 54-Hole Mark in Western Tourney
